Life of Pi was one of the best books I've read in a while, I loved it. Often a movie is disappointing when compared to the book but I think they did an excellent job of capturing the essence of the book. There were a few minor changes, which my wife quibbled about but all in all a wonderful job of capturing a magical story. The 3D was nicely done.
 The story itself is about an Indian boy who has a great interest in religion (Hindu, Christian, and Muslim) whose family owns a zoo in India. His family leaves India for Canada, taking the animals with (sold to zoos in Canada). The ship sinks in the Pacific and only Pi, a bengal tiger (Richard Parker), an orangatang (Orange Juice), a zebra with a broken leg and a hyena make it into the lifeboat.

The movie moves a bit slow at first, using a lot of details to set up the theme.  The acting is good.  It becomes quite exciting as the move continues. While the scenes flow together well, you can't really anticipate what will happen next.  At the end you are left with two views of the tail and must decide which is the "truth."

It's good to see a little different kind of storyline.
It moved slow but a good movie the whole family can watch.
Outstanding movie.  The photography and the story line are wonderful. We've watched it numerous times since we received it and will watch it again and again.

Was blown away by the gorgeous visual effects of this movie.  The story had many deep levels.  We started to watch it with our 7 year old son not knowing if it would be too adult for him.  The tiger growled and lashed out at the boy too much for him as he was scared-due to incredible visuals.  So my husband and I watched it later after our son went to bed.  I may not reccomend it to kids under 9.  Our son loves Star Wars and isn't afraid of Darth Vader.  I supposed the Tiger was too realistic for him.  This is a movie I would own and watch over and over again.
An entertaining blend of the surreal with the harsh realities of suvival at sea.  How many of the events were real, and how many were delusions brought on by extreme thirst and hunger?

My granddaughters raved about this movie and insisted I watch it. They loaned their copy to me, convinced I would buy it after watching it.  No way!  Their uncle and I watched and both thought it was just weird.  A guy who may or may not have survived due to his own ruthlessness, then covered it up with animals he fantasized to replace the real humans in the story he told.  That's all we got from it.
Very good acting, the story was interesting, and I enjoyed the music/soundtrack.  Sometimes the storms lasted a long time, but there were many lovely, magical moments that balanced things out.
Beautiful images, great story line!, Good move to watch by yourself to get the full experiences. Might need to watch it multiple time to get full grasp of it, but worth it.

Very intense, thought provoking movie!
My 11 year old son really liked it.
It touched upon many emotions.
May be disturbing for some children & young teens.
I watched this in 3D on a Panasonic Plasma. Visually stunning, great entertainment.  3D has effects outside the screen but the depth of the ocean scenes are just fantastic.
Very good and engaging story. This movie is good for both family movie night or just watching alone. Cinematography was excellent.
This was a very heartfelt movie.  The graphics was outstanding.  The story line was on point, and touch the heart.
This story has plenty of feeling and multiple meanings.  Its a good philosophical thinking movie.  You will have something to think about and talk about with friends and family afterwards.
Had intent and pushed the agenda rather than allowing one to draw one's own conclusions.  I found this to overshadow the beauty of the cinematography.
Visually stunning to watch, I felt the story was sweet, but the writing/acting was a bit on the cheesy side.
Not for the deep thinker. If you loved the book, you will love this movie, the cinematography is great. It provoked alot of discussion about the symbolism.
A visual and emotional masterpiece that will leave you so curious with the ending you'll watch a 2nd time right away.

Like a good mystery story? With an entertaining ending?
Add a great adventure, and a very realistic portrayal of a boy and a Bengal tiger surviving on a lifeboat, and you have a great movie. Wrapped up inside this movie, with more than enough action to keep our attention, is the question of a search for the meaning of God, in a way that even the most devout (of any religion) can accept and learn from.
I'm not giving out any spoilers, which would be so easy in discussing the conflicts in the film, but it's clear that this coming-of-age story has enough going on to keep both teens and adults entertained, and that's on the small screen.
We missed it in theaters, but even on our small 32" in SD we were completely caught up in the story. If you've got a large HD TV, you're in even better luck, since the astonishing life-like special effects and the glorious scenery will keep you glued to the set.
Pre-teens may cringe at the accurate portrayal of wild animal behavior, but it's little more than any one could see on a National Geographic special, and is entirely in keeping with reality. I mean, there are no talking animals, and they are not "humanized" in any fashion. A tiger is a tiger is a tiger, in other words.
The color is vivid, the nature scenes are real, the story line is very appealing (based on true events), and the acting is more than one might expect, and there is one surprise cameo appearance for French film aficionados.
Prepare to be enchanted.

The cinematography is beautiful, the story is fantastic and it serves as a lesson to everyone.  This should be required viewing for every religious zealot in the world.  Christian, Muslim, Buddhist or Other.

It is easy to see why the movie was awarded so many Academy Awards. We had our doubts as we usually don't watch animal movies. We did not know what it was about. It was a wonderful story. Grabbed our attention immediately.
The movie gives you a quirky, curve ball at the end, that if you think about what was said, and what you watched, left you a tad empty.

The imagery and photography in this movie was really great. At first the movie dragged, but once aboard the freighter, the movie held my interest throughout the rest.  I found it very thought provoking and continue to think about the themes of the movie afterward.
Great special effects but too long and difficult to understand language or accents without closed captioning. Watch at your own risk.

I really enjoyed this movie's way of grappling with issues like: confronting your greatest fear(s); trusting in the Universe and never giving up hope; letting go of attachment to self-identity; accepting life as it is and surrendering to whatever the Universe has in store for you.
Visually stunning but the story kind of drags on a different parts.  We enjoyed it but probably wouldn't buy it on BlueRay.

The author, not yet 40 (amazingly) when he wrote the book, has been quoted as saying:

"Suddenly, my mind was exploding with ideas. I could hardly keep up with them. In jubilant minutes whole portions of the novel emerged fully formed: the lifeboat, the animals, the intermingling of the religious and the zoological, the parallel stories.  Where did that moment of inspiration come from? Why did I think that religion and zoology would make a good mix? ...I could give approximate answers. That India, where there are so many animals and religions, lent itself to such a story. That tensions simmering just below my level of consciousness were probably feverishly pushing me to come up with a story. But in truth I don't know. It just happened."

"It just happened...." the rendering of raw life into something far more profound, something universal, a tale known by heart by an unfortunate number of souls who have experienced a "shipwreck"; and, a morality tale, one that can transcend the obvious carnal horror and touch upon that which is beyond our experience, that in which our experience has its being, and its purpose.

What is a shipwreck? One is journeying toward something, with hope, and the vicissitudes of life foul the journey.  When the "ship" goes down, everything is lost.  One is left in a hostile world surrounded by the unknown and the horizon disappears twice a day, dawn and dusk, into itself.  There are no markers, there are no maps.

A tragedy for which there are no words, a loss so deep that it rivals the power of nature, an ocean of loss.  I know this by heart. I, too, now live with a very large and very dangerous animal.  This is a fight for survival, it is no game, it is no fairy tale.  I feed the beast as best I can and try to avoid it.  Ultimately, I must learn about it and it must - in some way - co-exist with me.  Together, uncomfortable companions, we seek safe harbor.  Safe harbor is far from safe, it is self-consuming.  The only safety is in not looking for it; the only path is back into the journey, the beast and I, toward life.  Can we find it, can we survive? I will not be consumed by the beast, but neither can I consume it.  We are together now, whatever the future.

Shall I tell my story in its brutal reality, tearing into the consciousness and sensitivities of those who hear it?  I learn that this is not a prudent choice.  And so I tell it in this way, as I have said, the beast and I.  Everyone fears the beast, do they not?  Yet, not everyone travels with one, and so the story can be safely told.

There is magic and even beauty in even the worst horror.  Nothing is without purpose; this is part of the lesson.

You cannot tame the beast.  There must be a partnership, a reluctant partnership.  You may find comfort in the oddest of places and when least expected but, ultimately, you must continue the journey.  Or die trying.

"Even when God seemed to have abandoned me, He was watching.  Even when He seemed indifferent to my suffering, He was watching.  And when I was beyond all hope of saving, He gave me rest, and gave me a sign to continue my journey."

Evil and horror are real, but they are encapsulated, they are quarantined from the essential element of soul.  The beast can enter our lives; we can succumb to the horror and be eaten alive, by our own lack of hope and loss of faith.  Or we can arrive at a place where we, and our beast, co-exist.  I am not yet at the place where my beast leaves me.  Perhaps I never will be.  There is something in us that wants to hold onto the beast.  And we are left with two stories: the horror or the hope.

"Can I ask you something?"
"Of course."
"I've told you two stories  about what happened out on the ocean.  Neither explains what caused the sinking of the ship and no one can prove which story is true and which is not.  In both stories, the ship sinks, my family dies, and I survive."
"True."
"So which story do you prefer?"
"The one with the tiger, that's the better story."
"Thank you.  And so it goes with God."

This review pertains to the 3D version of Life of Pi.

First off, do not purchase this for the 3D.  I was really shocked at how little 3D there actually was in this film, especially considering all of the hype around this being "the next Avatar".  I own probably every major 3D Blu-ray release, and this was a huge disappointment.  It was like "3D" was just slapped on the cover as an afterthought, and no effort went in to the transfer of the source material to Blu-ray 3D.

Other movies like Jurassic Park 3D, Prometheus 3D, and even in Men in Black 3D blow this away in the quality of the visuals.
An excellent movie. Very creative. It was nice to watch a movie that for once has no swear words nor nudity. Refreshing.

Oh my it jumps of the screen.  Being filmed in the ocean the 3 d graphics are great and the story line is one of the best too.  Great for Kids!

I loved the graphics of the tiger and other animals depicted in this film, but the storyline was a bit long and boring.

We decided to rent this movie at the last moment.
It holds your attention and you become very involved with the story line.
It was great
This is one of the rare cases where the movie is as good or better than the book.  Great action and excellent acting.
This was a good movie.  The movie made you think about how people deal with unfortunate situations that can happen in life
This movie was very well done.  Not only did my young grandchildren enjoy it and learn from it, but Pi's character provoked some very deep thinking on the part of the adults who watched it together.

This is now one of several occasions where I have tried to stream from Amazon.  The majority of the time, it does not work.  So, regarding the Life Of Pi, I really wanted to watch it but it became so frustrating every minute or so, I just shut it off.  I'm sure it's a great movie, but I haven't actually "seen" it.  I'll keep trying.
Subtitles difficult to read against screen colors, dialect difficult for those who are not accustomed to this language.  Story was great, I would recommend it to others.

The visual effects, set design, and costume design of this movie is just phenomenal.  It covers scenery that I can't even dream of.  For those of you that love nature and wild life, for those of you that are actively searching for the meaning of life, this movie is highly recommended.  I feel like I can discover more every time I re-watch it.
We will watch this movie over again, mining more out of the thought provoking themes.  Very well presented with excellent scenery.

I knew there would be some neat effects, but never imagined what would happen when we played this movie on our 3D TV.  The story is good and the graphics and 3D effects knock you right out of your seat.  What a fun experience right in your own home.  So glad I bought it.

I ordered the movie based on outstanding reviews vs. basically less awards than possible...a combo I tend to like....and this was no disappointment.  The movie moves well, and while the story seems unbelievable, you want to believe it; and, the ending relieves and enlightens.  I don't want to give more particulars so as not to spoil the adventure of viewing it for yourself.
Good story line (can't say great). What sets this movie apart from many others is the fantastic use of ALL video and computer graphic arts available. I watched it over 3 times!

Best ever cinematography.  Amazing graphics.  Great animal scenes.  A pleasure to watch.  But the story was the best part.  It is hard to comment on it without giving away the plot, but let's just say that I was replaying the movie in my head for days.

This movie seems to have it all: beautiful pictures, intriguing story, meaningful message, and competent actors. It has some good combination of all of that that it makes it both very "entertain" and "educational".
Just fun. The boy actor that plays young Pi is fantastic. Will become one of my favorite movies of all. Must see for all.
Really good movie. About a boy who believes in several religions, not sure how I felt about that. But not one I could watch more than once.
The movie began very well.  It held my curiosity until the very end..... at which time I was very disappointed.  It was sort of a 'non-ending'.  :)
The mixture of religions was interesting.  I am glad I didn't pay $10 each to see it in the theater.

Cinematically stunning.
Incredible acting.
Exciting multi-leveled story -- loved the conversations
Theologically flawed but does pull the viewer towards God
rather than away from Him.

Not a huge fan of director Ang Lee. If you enjoyed Crouching Tiger then you will certainly enjoy more tiger.  Irrfan Kahn was the most realistic character in the film, which leads me to believe that the film would have been better, from the required CGI to build it, as an animation.
this movie started kind of slow just like slumdog millionaire but give it a chance, this was a GREAT movie!
Great movie! One you can watch over and over. Will most likely purchase this, since I only rented it. Loved it!
This film is visually stunning but is also a wonderful story about the will to live and knowing one's self. I'd also suggest the book.

This is a spectacular movie, presented with stunning beauty and unbelievable adventure.  It's also a heart-breaking tale of love and loss, and a movie about relationships with self, family, animals and gods.  Throughout its harrowing story, it also delves into the quiet mysteries of how we relate to others -- human and otherwise -- and to the world around us.  It's a tough movie to watch if you're an animal lover -- I was speechless and in tears for a very long time after it ended.  Don't be fooled by it's quiet low-key introduction -- this is a powerful movie, emotionally wrenching and full of awe and wonder...

Finally a great movie starting a "Tiger!" We need more movies featuring one of nature's most beautiful creatures. Fantastic movie for families and anyone, really. I watched it over a couple of days and it takes you on an emotional ride. It asks a lot of questions about the human spirit and how fragile we really are. It seems God is the ultimate practical joker and should we take God so seriously, makes you think!

MOPOP

This was one of my favorite movies! Very well-done and excellently filmed. It shares some good philosophies (without getting too preachy). Good action, heart-warming story. The cinematography was outstanding! I streamed this through my Roku (from Amazon Instant video) and was very, very pleased with the HD, the sound, and the stunning cinematography.
The TV ads made this look very tempting, but the preview didn't impress me much.  Not a movie I would pay to view.

I Loved this movie!  The photography was beautiful and the animal scenes were sooo vivid, like they were reaching out to grab you!  The storyline was very personal & inspiring.  Just an all around great film!!  Highly recommend that you see this!!  =)

This movie is amazing! It is exactly the opposite of what you expect after looking at the cover and reading the summary on the back, but it is still nonetheless an extraordinary film! Filled with beautiful cinematography and a very surprising twist at the end, this movie should definitely get a nod for "Best Picture of the Year."
I loved it, and the quality and sound is amazing as well. The movie itself is great, it makes you think a lot about yourself and your beliefs in the end and its an amazing story.
Good story. kept my interest although which was the real story? I wish I knew. He told it well though.
Excellant movie! Fell asleep at first but upon waking up Oh my goodness. The movie was fantastic made you think!

After the spectacular choices on the menu of 2012-13 Oscar movies, Life of Pi got pushed down the list of movies for me to see. I ended up waiting until its release, and I rented it from Amazon Instant.

After experiencing this in HD, it instantly became one of my favorites of the movie year. I would put this only behind Lincoln. This movies shows that a director can take the new high tech 3D tools of modern movie-making and craft an incredbile story. A story that does not rely on these new tools to make it an incredible movie, but one that tells a story that is only made more vivid and breathtaking by the use of said tools.

Not only do you leave this movie in awe of the visuals, but you leave it with a sense of mystery that lies at the heart of the movie. One that a viewer needs to experience to understand. There is an incredible mystery threaded through the movie, and one that comes to an interesting culmination in the end. This movie left me completely in agreement with the choice of Ang Lee as Best Director.

Please watch this movie before making an appraisal of this past year in movies.
Loved the movie and thought I understood untill the end. ( where the reporters wanted another story to publish ) I will watch it over and over
I was spell bound while watching this movie.  If you "blink" you will miss something.  I truly love this movie.

I enjoyed the ability to co-exist but...that's it
He should have continued with the story.
Where did the tiger end up?

I enjoyed Argo very much. It had tension and I'm old enough to know how it ended. Then there was that whole thing about the Oscar's snubbing Ben Affleck AND I had seen Argo before the gala event... I had no problem with their choice. I saw Life of Pi about two weeks later. Boom. The Oscar people suck, again. A great story. Great cinematography. CGI and puppetry that looks so real(don't waste time and attention looking for it now that I mentioned it or you could end up a pretentious schmuck who votes on future Oscar winners.
 And now I saw it in Blu Ray. Boom. Again. Buy this; rent this; see this movie.
I liked the way the movie followed the book so closely! the special effects were amazing and were better than i could imagine the scenes from the book!
While the story is indeed interesting and well told, the scenes out on the pacific are breath-taking.  I do recommend this movie to those who are philosophical.

This movie was not what I expected, but we were pleased.  It is a great family movie - clean, imaginative. My only complaint is the high price. This is only our second rental from Amazon - the first was only $1.99.  This was $4.99!!  I was disappointed with the pricing.

I enjoyed the movie but found it to be struggling to capture and reveal a clear storyline.  it seemed to get lost in trying to maintain an action line for those who watched to see the struggles of a Tiger and man alone in a boat and the the more meaning connection with the parable that could have been told.  Unfortunately, for me, it fell short on both sides.  I would rate it entertaining, but not worthy of a second viewing and short of my expectations. I was left numb rather than engaged and provoked as I had hoped to be.
Fantasy but this movie has  a very good lesson: sometimes the pesimistic people prefer believe in an ugly daily truth than a good fantasy story that keeps the ideal of life.
Beautiful cinematography (even if some computer enhancements were used - still stunning). A "feel good" film. I'll definitely watch it again.
A perfect movie for watching in 3D!  Great colorful movie for the family to watch.  Rich detail and good storyline.

I not only purchased this movie for myself but for my daughter in law also.  It was very enjoyable and the effects were beautiful.  My only regrets are that I did not see this in the IMAX.  I would recommend this movie for the family who has teenagers as I think they would enjoy it also.
Fantastic movie of a man surviving on a boat with a tiger. The story was great and their was some beautiful scenes. I highly recommend it. :)
Really interesting story with great cinematography. Beautiful pics. Would not recommend for small kids, but loved it for my husband and I..
This is a riveting and Intriguing story with lots to think about.  Engaged in the story the entire time. It is definitely worth watching!

NO spoilers or critique here.  And, I haven't read the book.

I watched it by myself in my version of a "home theater" (to achieve the full effect).  And, I'm glad I did.

However, little did I know I wouldn't realize the FULL affect until twelve hours later,...while I was at work (by myself, again), thinking about the story,...What's wrong with me?,...a fifty-year-old kid breaking down into a blubbering mess,...the entire weight of the story landed on me,...too much to tell.  I want everyone to experience it.  Maybe some won't.  Maybe some will.  And, hopefully, if you do, it'll happen during the movie, not twelve hours later.

At a minimum, the visuals are impressive, especially the dream/hallucination sequences.  And, two hours flew.
The acting was incredible. Only at the end do you realize the significance of the story....makes you honor the strangeness of LIFE.

Since watching the movie, I just had to have it.  From the special effects to the acting by the young men playing Pi, what a movie enjoyed every minute of it.  Brave to all involved in the making of this film.
average when it could have been great. the special effects were fantastic and there was a lot of good aspects to the movie, I just shouldn't have read the book first.
good story and visually stunning, followed book very closely.  the action kept you interested during the whole movie, and enjoyable right up to the end

I watched this movie last night with my family.  Very slow start but i stayed awake and watched the whole movie.  If I don't like a movie I will usually fall asleep during it.  The movie reminds me of Castaway but I enjoyed Castaway more.  I wouldn't buy it as I don't think I would want to watch it over and over but it's ok to see one time.  My advice...rent it from Redbox.
It was okay, but not what I was expecting. Loved the pictures of the animals in the being of the movie

3 dvds in the box. One is Blu-ray 3d.
My family and friend all watched the movie. The quality is great!
Cinematography is amazing !!  "Welcome to Pi's arc" very clever, animals are incredible, great acting. We watched it twice. Fab !

A great movie that demonstrates character and indurance.  The family relationship and obedience to parents is a fine example to follow.  The movie is even better the second and third time.
This is a visual feast.  It's amazing that water, a boat, and two characters could keep me entranced for two hours.  Beautifully done!

I get that this is more like a fairy tale, but honestly, the impossibility of it all just really made this fall flat for me.  And what a lackluster ending.  Again, I know it's more about philosophy, but...I didn't get it.  And I'm not that shallow!  If there wasn't great scenery and special effects, totally boring.

This is a great movie, gave me the impression since the beginning that it would be something like the Big Fish... and it was.. an incredible story!.. very recomended, the 3d quality is impressive and photography simply breathtaking.

This movie starts a little slow to build the story but once it does it will suck you in with both its visual beauty and powerful story line. I felt it ended a little oddly but other then that a great movie. Some spots might be a little tough to watch for younger children (animal death) but all in all a great family movie.

A little slow in the beginning.
The little kids were bored with it before the disaster in the sea. But great after that. I wonder which version really happened?

I feel this movie should have been the Best Movie in 2012.  Such a compelling story, breathtaking photography.  One of those special movies you hope everyone will have a chance to view.  Life Changing!
Well acted, awesome special effects, beautiful scenery, very imaginative film.  I highly recommend this amazing film.  We loved it.  Thumbs up.
This is a great movie for those who havnt seen it. Would watch it again and reccomend it to everyone
This was a very excellent movie.  It held my attention all the way thru.  Would have liked for PI and the tiger to have reunited again.

It's been a long time since I read the book, but if memory serves me correctly it seems that this movie does a good job at staying true to the story.  The animation was good and realistic, so while you knew the animals weren't all real you didn't care because they were close enough.  The story told what it had to, did it well, and moved along at a pretty good pace.  All in all it was quite entertaining.

If you're a Christian realize that you'll probably have to discuss with your kids the inherent difficulties of co-opting all religions into one, as the main character does.  His father tells him that believing in everything is much like believing in nothing, which is all too true but an issue that the main character never addresses.  But in the end the final message about faith in general is a good one.

Thanks to Ang Lee for bringing us this wonderful journey of Pi
This movie is so deeply profound and yet kids love it
The movie was beautifully filmed and stuck to what I remember from the book. I am still thinking about which story I believe...
Good movie with a lot more message than I thought going into the movie....well done....and I thought the videography was quite good as well
I totally enjoyed this movie.  It moves a little slow in the middle but it is worth the wait for the action to start again.
What a great movie to watch! Enjoyed it much !!! I really like this movie a lot! The graphic, story, music, vision effects, animals! All great!!
The story is much more complicated than the special effects.  I may have to read the book now that I have the gist of the story.
Very entertaining. Found it interesting how the Gospel of Jesus dying for the sins of man was made so plain in this secular film. It was a film of courage and faith.

would never watch this movie again and would not recommend to anyone I like. this movie bored me. Too far fetched maybe a child would like but I don't think this can keep their attention for very long

I loved the novel and could not imagine how it could be made into a film.
Ang Lee does an amazing job and holds true to the novel.
How did they get the animals appear like that, truly a wonder of digital film .
Life of Pi is a great story.  Best is that no blood, guts & gore were shown!!  That was left to one's imagination.
Great movie that works even better in 3D. Well worth the money and deserving of all the oscars it won

i  found it beautiful, sad, and real, yes yese,yse.the
this is stupid, why should i bother to write and waste my time
I really enjoyed the story behind the scene.  The effects were awesomely done.  Seeing how the tiger & Pi became friends was an experience on it's own.  Anyone of any age should enjoy this movie.
The humor, editing, every bit of the movie was a gem.  The sheer mastery of how human and animal emotions intertwine stuck a real chord in me as an animal lover.  This is a movie for the ages.

I wasn't sure what to expect from this movie, but it certainly wasn't the philosophical bent that was presented.  I loved the views on religion and at the end Pi's "which story do you prefer?" just said everything that needed to be said.

This movie kept me engaged throughout the whole thing and I cannot think of another movie I have seen recently that did that.  One of the best flicks I've seen in a long time.  I paid $5 for the rental and will still be buying it.  LOVE LOVE LOVE this movie! So did my 3 year old who doesn't like anything except cartoons lol some of the content went over her head and was a little too mature for her but she loved it. 5 STARS!
Great movie overall as well as the book. I would recommend people who have just watched the movie to read the book.
Excellent movie experience well worth a watch academy award winning movie I think excellent special effects a well put together story and overall movie
This was a long-awaited film for me after reading the book a number of years ago and then listening to the audible book on my daily commute I now have amazing visual interpretation.

Mesmerizing images abound throughout this movie and will keep your attention whether or not you find the story hard to swallow. The 3D effects are not overdone. Though a little longer than expected, I've watched it twice and could watch it again.
Amazing movie. Beautiful to look at, entertaining and with a great message. It would be easy to rewatch several times.

I found it to be a bit boring until the very end.
As well, the "swimming" movement of the water and animals
made my eyes go crazy.

I get Pi.  I really get him.  I know about animals having souls.  They are sentient.  I held myself together during the ship sinking.  The scene in the lifeboat with the broken zebra, the grieving orangutan and the hyena was more than I could bear (no pun intended).  While Pi was screaming no, I went fetal, covered my ears and screamed NOOOOOOOOOO.  Then I ejected the disc.  I couldn't sleep and had nightmares. I'm 54 years old.  If I had seen this as a child, I would have spent months in my parents bed.
I loved every scene,every second of the movie. A definite one time see and I am all the more sure that kids will just love it

I enjoyed the book and enjoyed comparing the book to the movie. I agree it was well done considering how difficult the imagery was. I am not sure how much I would have enjoyed the slow parts with no book history.

Director Ang Lee is getting better and better in telling stories.  The blu-ray version of the movie will bring out the best of a great television set.  The movie was so well made, two plus hours went by very quickly.

This movie was fantastic for our whole family! Even though the younger members didn't understand everything in the plot,the amazing graphics and animal scenes kept them happy! Those of us that did understand everything were impressed and moved emotionally..... Great acting and scripting! LOVED it!!!

There is a scene with a Hyena killing a Zebra in a lifeboat and then fighting in the same boat with an Orangutan. How can a movie with such a graphic scene be rated PG?  This movie should be rated at least PG-13.  If you have little kids please watch the movie yourself first and decide if it is appropriate for your little ones. The Rating board did an awful job in rating this movie.

This is an amazing film.  It is the first film I've seen in the theater that uses 3D to truly enhance the story and the movie-going experience.  In 3-D this is a breathtaking movie to watch.  But it is so incredibly well-done that the 2D version is just fine for home viewing, especially on a big-screen TV.

This is a very unusual story about a spiritual young man who survives an incredible ordeal at sea. When you get to the story's end, you may find yourself going over it in your mind for days, working out the details. Visually it is gorgeous and awe inspiring at times. A friend who saw it on the big screen said it was even more impressive, and I can see why. But it carries over pretty well to the tv screen as well. Parts of the story are full of adventure as young Pi deals with the tiger on board and brutal storms at sea. I think this movie was difficult to market. It is not a story for little kids about animals, etc.. It is pretty heavy duty philosophically and spiritually. Some of the events may even be too disturbing for young children. Maybe 12 and up or a bit younger for mature kids. If you like to think, if you enjoy philosophy, if you seek God, if you are open to the stories and perspectives of others, you will enjoy this film. It is very well done.

I heard from friends and reviewers how great this movie is, but the previews made it look so cheesy. So when I finally saw it, I was blown away! The preview is usually a seletion of the best scenes of a movie. This film is so much deeper and artistic than I could imagine. I Love it.
I wasn't expecting much from this movie and I ended up really liking it. The graphics are great. The story is good. There are some really silly lines here and there. Rawr.

No bad language that I recall and if you like good cgi, it is very impressive in this movie.  The story was a bit lame and I thought the ending was anti-climactic and predictable.  :(  so 2 stars for the story  and 5 for the F/X.  3 average
This film is no only visually stunning, it keeps you on edge as to what will happen next. Highly recommended.

READ THE BOOK AND LOVED IT! THE MOVIE FOLLOWED THE STORY BUT LACKED SOME OF THE DETAIL.
THE BOAT SEEMED TOO SMALL TO ME. THE TRAINING OF THE TIGER COULD OF BEEN PLAYED UP
MORE.

Though I thought less of the movie than the book,, the images were quite satisfying.  There were moments when the story line were unclear such as the ending.  Some of the images were a bit too contrived.  Having experienced ocean storms I thought these images to be both striking and true.
ONE OF THE BEST 3D MOVIE'S OUT AT THIS TIME,VERY GOOD 3D AND AUDIO.MOVIE KEPT ME INTRESTED TILL THE END.R.KING
I liked this movie. It is very well done and the 3D made it better. Tiger, Hyena, monkey, zebra and whale. (There's your 5 words)

Life of Pi

I just loved this movie worth watching again and again,
Rented this the first time plan on buying this on DvD

Incredible cinemotography, and interesting spiritual dimension, however, it's long and drawn out, not something I would view again.
I have explained to others my comment above.

I really liked the book.  That said I accept that a movie can never have as much information in it as a book (unless it is a very short book), and that movies are visual representations of what goes on around a character, and most books tend to look inside the character - thus the translation from books to film has an inherent flaw that will always be there.  That didn't stop me from wanting to see this film, because, c'mon: you just want to SEE the boy on the lifeboat with the tiger from the moment you start to read that section of the book.  In that this movie succeeded very well.  Special effects are getting better and better, and where-as in Jumanji, the CGI animals pulled you out of the movie - these succeed in being believable.  All in all a pretty faithful adaptation, with some very beautiful visuals.

I had to take the "middle road" and give three stars for this movie.

Pros: It had a great theme and there were places that made me actually "jump out of my seat!" It was realistic in the continued weight loss of both the lion and the boy. I got the movie in 3D and the intro was really breath taking!

Cons: I couldn't understand much of the conversation in the first part of the movie. Iit was very boring and shot in some low light settings which combined with the low, muffled and heavily accented speech made the movie impossible for me to understand what was taking place!  I couldn't get into the movie until the "action" began. I still had a hard time understanding the actor but the action made up for that. After the breath taking intro, I didn't notice very much if any 3D effect throughout the rest of the movie.

All in all, this movie was "just ok" but it could have been excellent if  the directors had enhanced the speech so I could have understood what they were saying. :-(

It was attention grabing. I almost felt swept away along with the character in the first scene with the water. The cinematography was awesome full of color and excitement. Also check out A Voice Behind Thunder (Indigo)

Take Avatar, Gandhi and cast a way and roll them together with a little Tarzan and you have a sense of the scope you will experience in the Life of Pi. It is a keeper and in my hall of fame of movies.
Cool flick. Decide for yourself whether the story was one big cluster of metaphors e.g. Pi was the tiger,  etc.
We had seen all the commercials on this movie, but did not see it when it came through our town, so I surprised the wife and purchased it as a gift. We both loved it.
Great movie...was wonderful to sit as a family to watch it without worrying about language or sex scenes!  Too intense for younger children, though.
Cinemanography was superb as were the the storyline and the plot development. The questions posed about life and spirituality were thought provoking.

This is the second movie I have rented in which the streaming was terrible. I have a newer Samsung tv I purchased from Amazon last fall, so it's not the television. I checked my internet service and it is working fine.
Not even close to Avatar - quite the disappointment from a visual perspective. The story was so simple the telling had to be superb, I don't think it was.

It was an inspiring movie with a great storyline.  I was worried it would be "boring" as most of it was shot near the raft adrift at sea however, it kept you focused and there were many funny lines to keep you smiling.  Very well written and directed.

I thought this movie was a great adventure movie plus one that gave a real message.  I never thought something that seemed so unrealistic - a boy sharing a boat with a tiger - could seem so possible and real.
This movie Life of Pi is a beautiful movie.  It is good for the entire family.  I highly recommend it.

Floating island concept is meaning less
screenplay is good overall..
flying fish scene is good.
more of documentary type movie, but overall we can watch once.

Awesome film, visually stunning. I have encouraged so many of my friends to watch them telling me " it wasn't their type of film" only to tell me they really like it as well.

Blu-Ray and 3D really complement the visual elements of this film.
Watch this movie.  It's a fascinating story.  I haven't read the book, but this oscar winning film was definitely worth 2 hours of your time.
Again, there was ocean view in this movie and very much of spirituality, beliefs, and so much confident to survival.
When reading  the book I thought they could never make a movie out of this, but was I wrong! The movie was magnificent!!!
Stunning movie. Very well made. I highly recommend it. I have not read the book so have no idea how much the two correlate. I think anyone who watches it would like it.
I ordered this for my son for Easter, and it arrived very timely.  He really likes the movie, as well as the rest of us.

I heard all about this movie from my mother-in-law so maybe I was expecting more because she was really impressed.  Overall, it kept my attention and had great graphics. Loved the graphics and Christian values!
This movie has mystery, wonder, truth, adventure and love.  I love this movie, I had to buy it.  A beautiful movie to hold on to.
I expected to not be a big fan.  Love that there is a  lot of humor involved in a touching movie.

This movie is all about the message the story tells. Very inspiring film with a powerful message. I highly recommend this movie!
this was a great movie.  It had great scenery, great casting great story, and great acting. I recomend it to every one.
Great movie, my fiancee didn't even fall asleep during this one. Tense at times, fantastical at others, but those moments make it great.
Powerful movie! A must see for its powerful storyline and awe inspiring scenes!  The cast did a phenomenal job piecing together this incredible journey of survival!

Interesting but I will wait to find the dvd at a discount.

I thought it was so good I read it twice. We saw the movie and even bought the DVD. I think we need more books like this.

I read the book first.  The graphics and the reality protrayed in the movie are unbelieveable!  The story line is very close to the book.  I recommend this movie to anyone who like suspense!  The actors a really tremendous!
this movie was amazing, a must see.the visuale effects are amazing, but the truely amazing part of this movie is the story it's self.

Movie was horrible. I turned it off about 3/4 through it due to the terrible story line. I would rather watch paint dry for two hours. Absolutely horrendous. DON'T WATCH THIS TRAIN WRECK.
The movie got great reviews and it deserved them all! At and during and after the ship wreck was sad and exciting with a great twist at the end - Very good movie.

Very nice story.  Great special effects. The whole family enjoyed it very much. Even though a low priced item (17USD) it came with all the bells and whistles more expensive blurays come with like several audio channels,  subtitles and so on.  Great value.

Don't know what they did differently with the 3d but I couldn't watch it at all. I have about 20 3d movies and this and 'the hobbit' (my last two 3d movie I've purchased is unwatchable in 3d). When there's a still picture, it looks fine but when you get movement, it was completely blurry and gave me a huge headache. This doesn't happen in any of my other 20 3d movies I own. Also, the story is a great one. As with "Slumdog Millionaire," it focuses on a young Indian man in a seemingly impossible situation. Suffice to say, adversity grows the soul. But that is where any similarity with "Slumdog Millionaire" ends. My best advice is to give this movie a chance and experience its best qualities. It may not change your life, but it can brighten your day. Enjoy! Fr. Dennis

Let me start off by saying the 4 stars are for the movie itself.

The film is quite interesting and very well developed. I wasn't crazy about some of the CGI animals, but overall it was pulled off rather well. I've read other reviews asking why he kept doing a certain thing and it makes me think that maybe people didn't fully understand the movie. Others complained that it was slow, but the pacing seemed fine for this type of film. It's not supposed to be a big action movie so I can't imagine anyone wanting to speed up the story telling. In a lot of ways, it made me think of Ernest Hemingway's book The Old Man and The Sea. It felt very much like that in so many ways, but Pi puts in a little more craziness. Overall, I thought the film was very good and worth the rental fee.

Now, as far as the blu ray disc...it doesn't seem to work in all players. I actually rented the Blu Ray disc and it would not play in my blu ray player. I did the usually stuff like updating the firmware to the latest update. Still, no go. I tried playing it in my computer which has a blu ray player. Nothing. I updated the blu ray software on my comp and still nothing. I did some research and some people have stated that because of a very new type of menu on the blu ray not all players will be able to play it, even with all available updates. It seems that some companies have not updated their software / firmware to make the blu ray work, but I am sure it will be fixed very soon. I had the same problem with the blu ray version of Skyfall. Hopefully, this issue can be worked out as I prefer the clarity of a blu ray over a dvd.

Unfortunately I did not enjoy this movie as much as so many others did. As a matter of fact I was hugely disappointed. A friend of mine had encouraged me to see this movie, and rather gushed over it. "It was so amazing", she said. The strange thing about this movie is it really resembled The Tree Of Life and The Fountain. Although The Life Of Pi definitely had a more developed story than the other two. I won't go into too much detail, I will however give my customary parent of children warning: The movie plays on Pi's name where they change it to "P!ssing". And they say "P!ssing" over and over. Over twenty times. They just won't let it die. Kids, adults, narrator, everyone is saying it. Its not that funny and the thick Indian/Hindu dialect makes it so hard to even understand the joke, all you hear is "P!ssing"! Then there is the scene where Pi is standing with his back to the camera and you see him urinating on the tarp of the boat. The animated lion then turns his rear to Pi and sprays Pi in the face with urine. Necessary to the movie? No. Big movie execs thinking the adults will love it? Yes. And that's the end of my parents with children warning. Unless of course you want me to cover the many animals that are attacked and die. But I am sure others have warned you of that. I believe the story could have been more believable, understanding, or even more enjoyable had they not had the weirdness intermingled in it. You never know if the story is real or if he is hallucinating. Even at the end when he is explaining to the investigators what really happened on the ship, he tells two different stories. Supposedly one is true, but they are both so far out you really don't know which one is true at all. The human acting was pretty good, however the animation of all of the animals really took away from the story rather than enhance it. Overall, I would never recommend this movie to anyone. Friend or enemy. I struggle with giving it one star even, but since it wasn't near as bad as The Tree of Life I am going to up it a star. I wish I could understand and enjoy these "great" movies as much as everyone else does. But I just. don't. get. it.

His courage and intelligence in a time of crises when most people would have just given up, yet he found a way to tame a wild animal and to survive a sea disaster was totally captivating.

Words cannot express how amazing this movie is!  I took my 9 and 11 year old daughters to see it, as my youngest is a tiger fanatic.  I had no idea it was a best selling book (have since bought the book).  I was left in tears at many parts, due to its beautiful theme and story.  The acting was stellar, pulling you into the character. Cinematography was beyond words on its brilliance, just stunning.  Even my husband loved it all.  My kids still ask me philosophical questions about it, it leaves you with many questions, some that can be answered, some not so easily.  But that is the beauty of it, we never truly know all the answers, do we?

I loved the movie itself. It's entertaining, full of anticipation and unexpected. I started the movie full of hope to watch Pi generously, humbly, search for God and truth. It ended with the modern PC dogma that reduces God and truth to whatever I want to think. It kills the search for truth, because everything is truth. By killing the search for truth and reducing it down to whatever I want to interpret it as, suddenly there is no morality I must adhere to either. To all those people who voice frustration wondering what was the point of this movie and what was the truth of what happened... you're right on. That's the movie's message about all of life. All religion, science, and morality, comes down to whatever you want to interpret it to be. We all interpret things differently so that means we can all be right at the same time. That everyone can judge what happened to Pi for themselves is completely dissatisfying. We want to know truth, not to make it up. The father in the movie said that if you believe everything, you believe nothing. Searching for truth is satisfying. Making it up as you go is not. I recommend this book. Absolute Relativism: The New Dictatorship and What to Do about It If I'm completely off in my interpretation of the message of this movie please correct me. .

I have noticed some reviews that touch upon the ending of the movie with anger and frustration.  Most ignore the ending all together, as though this were purely a nature or adventure film.  Can one ignore the last half hour of a movie such as The Sixth Sense?  Or, The Usual Suspects, which has a similar ending?

Clearly this is a movie (and novel) about believing, or not believing in God.  The young Pi had a horrible, traumatic experience that he could not (or did not WANT to) remember.  He had to assist in the operation of a sailor with an infected leg, saw the dead sailor being used as bait for food, saw his mother die, saw his mother eaten by sharks, and, then, had to kill a man (the cook) himself.  Who would not want to create an alternative story--one in which God intervenes to make things more bearable?
And, yet, at the end Pi asked people to choose which story they prefered.  This is tantamount to asking someone if they want to believe in reality, which can be cruel, or believe in God, which can be comforting.  That is what this entire movie is about!  Does that make it less appealing than a good adventure story?  Obviously, the answer must be "YES" for most people, based on the reviews I have read.

Second, the older PI, played by Suraj Sharma, is a master storyteller, that sucked me in from the beginning.

Ang Lee's film "Life of Pi" is a technological marvel, perfectly blending 3D and state of the art digital effects with a great adventure story which is also remarkably spiritual. It all comes together for a deeply moving motion picture experience.

The Blu-ray is stellar as well. The film features some of the best usage of 3D since James Cameron's "Avatar" and Martin Scorsese's "Hugo". It's perfectly replicated on this 3-disc collector's edition. This set also includes a standard 2D version of the film which also looks amazing. Audio is fully immersive and perfectly replicates the film's sonic power.

The extras are spread over the 2D and 3D Blu-ray discs. These include deleted scenes, a detailed hour-long "making of" documentary, and additional features which explore the film's Oscar-winning visual effects. Also included in this version is a DVD copy of the film and digital copies (iTunes & Ultraviolet). Overall, a great value and a great Blu-ray package!

Ang Lee does a masterful job of bringing this story to life with beautiful computer animation.
Life of PI is about a man who survives a disaster at sea and is hurtled into an epic journey of adventure and discovery. While cast away, he forms an amazing and unexpected connection with another survivor...a fearsome Bengal tiger.

The special effects are breathtaking and fantastically done.  Although the story does start a little slow, the story is masterfully told and keeps you entertained til the end.  The symbolism is amazing and gives you things to consider about which story you would rather hear.

I highly recommend as it is worth a watch and a purchase.  Worthy of all the awards it has received.

There are some subtitled parts in this movie, but these sections are brief and not a lot to read, so there shouldn't be too much groaning from those people who hate to have to read subtitles - hopefully knowing this going in will help you not mind so much.

I watched this on my pc via Amazon instant video (not in blu-ray, 3D or even HD) - and I have to say the cinematography is really beautiful!  It is an interesting story - how could someone have thought this up, could this have really happened or is it all someone's imagination?  (It seems it was imagination.)

The movie IS interesting, but as you might guess it would HAVE to be from the type of story it is, it sometimes feels long.  It does make you THINK now and then and so it stays with you, in your thoughts for a good time after the movie has ended.

The different actors used to portray "PI" in various stages/ages of his life do not seem to look enough like each other to escape notice - but it's ok.  It doesn't seem to hurt the movie at all, just pointing out that we noticed so you probably will too.

When PI is finally rescued, he is questioned about the loss of the ship (insurance, you know) - and they don't like his story (which you just watched, with the tiger and all) and so they ask him to come up with a more believable story.  When he relates the more believable version, he gets emotional and so you are left to wonder which is really true - and he asks which you prefer to be true.  Then the person PI is telling all this to notes correlation of the characters in each version, and I had to then replay the 2nd "believable" version for the insurance people to see that comparison for myself, so I was really glad I saw this on video and not live at the movies where I wouldn't have been able to do that.  ... it is an interesting little twist to the tale I think.

It's a very CLEAN movie so good for the family (though kids have to deal with the subject of how vicious animals can be - which is a good lesson, but you want to be aware of that before a very young child sees this, so you're prepared), and PI is just a likable character - which is a MUST for a successful movie).

I don't know if this is a movie I'd want to watch over and over - but it was one I did enjoy watching, and so I would recommend it to most viewers. (Some great special effects for the storms too!)

The film "Life Of PI" is spectacular.  The computer graphics are so very convincing and create beautiful scenes, especially the ocean scenes, for the viewer.  The film was gripping, keeping us on the edge of our seats throughout.  We had seen the Academy Awards show and knew the film won many awards.  Well-deserved!

This one is worth buying and watching this is a great movie to watch on a rainy night.

Enjoy this movie its a movie about life, trials and tribulations.

The story of The Life of Pi is relatively simple and yet, rather profound as well.  The basic story revolves around Pi, the main character, relating his story to a writer, about his experiences relating to a journey taken in a lifeboat with his "friends" after a storm destroyed the ship he was on with his family while journeying to America.  Since describing this film with too much detail in a review would rob another of the opportunity to simply experience this movie, I don't really want to say much more here.  Besides, if you really want to know, simply go to one of the movie review sites.  I just want to give my own general impressions here without the detail.

There are many who have found The Life of Pi either tedious and over-long or else object to the over-emphasis on "religion" and spirituality.  While I never found it tedious or dull, I did not buy into the "spiritual" bent of the movie either.  But you don't have to "buy-in" to that aspect of the movie in order to enjoy it.  After all, you are an observer and a fellow traveler with Pi and his "boat-mate(s)". Again, it is the experience that counts here; not that you have to agree with the beliefs of the main character.

Let me just say here that I am a wannabe 3D artist.  The 3D CG work in this film surpasses anything I have seen to date, including Avatar which I also loved.  I've enjoyed many other 3D works such as Toy Story, etc, but The Life of Pi is, as they say, in a league all it's own when it comes to the CG work.  I simply would not have believed this depth of realism was even possible and I'm directly involved in it!  It is this very sense of realism that brings this film to life and puts you in the boat and elsewhere with Pi.  Absolutely masterful work.

The Life of Pi is rated PG.  I have raised 5 kids and I don't think I would want to bring younger kids to this movie.  It is simply too intense for most younger children, in my opinion.  I really think that PG13 would have probably been more appropriate.  That, of course, depends on the maturity of each child.  Some younger kids could handle it just fine.  Like all such things, you've just got to know your kids.  Just be warned before plunking one of your little ones down in front of this.

The Life of Pi is not a perfect film and certainly has it's flaws.  I found the ending particularly confusing and even a bit frustrating. I won't tell you why because that would give too much away.  But for me, at least, that was it's greatest and most serious flaw.  Yes, the religious mumbo jumbo was a little much sometimes.  Nevertheless, I thoroughly enjoyed this film.  It provided me with a movie-going experience that I will never forget.  I can't say that about too many films any more.
This is a wonderful film.  Not only did my grandchildren enjoy it (reason for purchase), but I thought it was a great production also.
Ang Lee is a daring and ambitious director and his decision to take on this otherwise unfillmable story turns it into one of the very few 3D masterpieces.

However, I was not a big fan of the story nor the plot. Also, the movie was a bit too long to keep my interest. Nevertheless, I was entertained for most of the movie. There is good humor sprinkled throughout, and production quality was excellent. Families with children may enjoy this movie given the settings, abundance of animals in the movie, and an all in all uncontroversial story.

I would not recommend this movie to most of my friends, and I certainly would not recommend them to buy it. Unless you have read the book and love the story, I would recommend this as more of a rental if you are set on watching it, and not so much as one to keep in your library.

The 3D film is outstanding in quality and illusion, but unlike most DVDs, there are no clear instructions or options seen as the DVD opens other than when to use the 3D glasses. As a result, it is very difficult to get the DVD out of showing the trailer loop over and over. On almost all DVDs the options for playing scenes, or total film are clearly stated as the DVD opens; that does not happen with this DVD. There were 3 discs in the Collector's Edition I purchased. One disc offered the 3D version, and after we finally got out of the trailer loop we got to see the film. The second disc is the non 3D version, and the third disc is supposed to offer behind the scenes details involved in the making of the film. It is impossible to get  beyond the trailer loop in the third disc after trying every possible routine that normally works on DVDs. I was sharing the experience with 6 well informed DVD users; they all tried to get the discs to run properly, and they also could not understand why these DVDs are so devoid of instructions on screen or in the printed material. Loved the film, hated the technology or lack of it.
Had me laughing, crying, and everything in between.  Amazing graphics and story.  Would definitely recommend this movie to anyone! :)

A visual feast for the eye, Life of Pi by far exceeds the expectations of Hollywood film-making... it's that good! Having read the book after the film (did not ruin the reading), the book club discussion I participated in agreed that the movie, unlike most, was better than the book! That director, Ang Lee took such a challenging story line and turned it into an unbelievably stunning movie shows bravery, daring and ... creative genius! While watching this movie on the big screen movie theater was spectacularly larger than life, the DVD Blue Ray (and likely, the regular DVD) is still equally awe-inspiring! The story line of this movie is inspiring, beautiful and thought-provoking. I'm thrilled to put this movie as one of my favorites of all times and truly the best visual cinematography ever produced.

This film is a masterpiece. It literally changed my life and my view of everything; from religion to God, to understanding how one can find God without religion and with religion I mean a structured congregation. When I finished watching Life of Pi it was as if an explosion occurred in my brain. I have watched numerous films in the past where all is great except the ending and I cringe in frustration but the ending of this film is genius. The words of adult Pi, especially, when referring to Richard Parker (the tiger) made me weep. This is and will forever be my all-time favorite film. PERFECTION!

From my friends and other reviews, I expected this movie to be an inspiration and spiritual story, but you hardly find anything inspiration or spiritual in it. It is a somewhat gruesome story of survival. The plot is interesting, cinematography breathtaking, and acting excellent, but after watching this movie, your do not feel an awe for the strength of human spirit that overcome tremendous challenges, or serenity of God's presence, surrender, understanding or even clarity. The movie leaves you feeling like a witness to a very traumatic, very gruesome, and very tragic situation with no hope really. Till the end you cannot distinguish fantasy of the main character from the reality of what happened, but that in itself is not a minus to the movie, its just facing a gruesome reality or facing the more beautiful and metaphoric view of the same reality, but nevertheless without hope or a presence of God.
This is a great story with fantastic videography! The entire family loved it, We had a great time discussing what really happened with our teens after the movie.

While the gorgeous cinematography of this movie alone makes it worth seeing, I wasn't impressed with it overall.  A man retells the events that he experienced as a boy during and after a shipwreck with zoo animals and his family.  The promise is made early on that this is a story that will "make you believe in God."  If this, indeed, is the purpose of the film, it failed miserably.  On that front, it was confusing at best.  I think it would be much more accurate to say, "This is a story that explains how some people view religion and ecumenicalism."  On the positive side, it does make the viewer think long after the show's over, but by the time I was done thinking, my analysis was that I didn't agree with the author.  Eh, it was probably worth seeing, but it's definitely not going to make my top 100 list.

A bit about the story. This is not a religious movie per se. It is the portrayal of a boy who finds himself in a horrendous situation, fraught with peril. He must draw on all he has learned and experienced in his young life to cope with the reality of the moment. It is a testament to the human will to survive against all odds. An uplifting experience.
This should not be missed.

This movie was a story of survival. It featured a boy on a boat in the middle of the ocean for the majority of the film. There were some long, drawn out parts that could have been shortened. My kids (12, 11, 9) sat through the entire thing, but all of us agreed we would probably never watch it again. The graphics were nice, lots of bright colors and scenes. The violence was mild, there were some animals that were killed. The ending was surprising (no spoiler alert) but tied the whole movie together so it made more sense. I don't recommend it for children younger than 9 who don't like killing animals though. Good one time movie, glad we only rented it. Nice way to pass a chilly afternoon.

Just as the mathematical expression is at once a rational number expressed by the fraction 22/7, so it is also an irrational number that can be expanded to an infinate number of characters. There are the logical questions. Does the character, Pi, survive days on end in an open boat in the middle of the Pacific Ocean with a raging tiger sharing the boat with this boy ?  Is this not also the story of a young person learning to control the wildness in himself while trying to survive the relentless storms which life throws at him ?

I will never know the answers.

I finally read the book as the movie was going into general release, mostly to get up to date with the tide of interest I expected it to generate. After reading it, I found myself resisting seeing the movie because I couldn't imagine how it could be realized, including that I thought if they were faithful to the story it would be both gory and grim. With the awards it won and consistently strong word of mouth from people I trust, I decided to watch. I found myself with time last weekend and ordered it and was blown away. Incredibly beautiful, with saturated, lush, better-than-the-real-thing colors for both the land and sea shots. Because it captures both the spirit and faithfully tells the story it is one of the best adaptations of a novel I've ever seen. Because of the emphasis placed on an alternative path for the story, I even understood the novel in a different and deeper way. The experience stayed with me all the next day. Stunning!

Life stories aren't always happy.  Pi's life is no exception.  It will fill you full of awe at times, but it will show you lows of great trajedy as well.  It is indeed an adventure, mostly of a young boy and young man. As a young boy his life was tormented by his full name, but filled with joy of learning about religion and animals in his families Zoo.  In time his family must sell out and board a freighter with some of their animals.  Trajedy strikes deep on that voyage, but Pi and a tiger survive.  Their adventure on the high seas is indeed full of wonder, but measured with the struggle of finding water and food.  Pi ends up telling us two stories and letting us decide which we like best.  I like the one with the tiger and I think you will too.  Great directing, acting, production values, and absolutely gorgeous camera work.

CA Luster

I sat on the sofa with my husband and teen aged children. I knew Life of Pi had won awards but I needed to read reviews before deciding whether to watch it. I read the reviews on Amazon before watching this movie. In fact I usually come to Amazon before making a final decision on a film. The part that baffles me is the negative reviews of this film. I don't understand why anyone would have compared this to Avatar or why anyone after watching the entire film would bother bringing Avatar up. The only reason I can fathom as to why anyone would dislike this movie is if they didn't understand it. And that in itself baffles me too. Visually, this movie was stunning. Period. The cinematography and effects were gorgeous. Gorgeous not like Avatar...gorgeous like Life of Pi. The two are two very very different types of movie. But by the end of this movie I knew that it was not just a film for entertainment sake or about visual effects. It was human, raw, and frankly the story isn't about the tiger, it's about the boy who survived. The story is his. No matter what the real ending is, matters not. What matters is that we as humans face sometimes the most unfathomable trials and challenges and how we handle them is entirely up to us. When I finished watching this and I was done wiping my tears away, I knew I wanted to see it again. Somehow I felt like the lessons in the story weren't all going to be caught on the first try. It is worth watching again for the parts I may have missed. I was in awe of the cast and how effortlessly they played their parts. There were times when I laughed, times when I cried, times when I cringed and that is what a movie experience is supposed to be. No, that is what story telling is supposed to be. This film most definitely deserved academy awards. And I'll end this review...this very simplistic review with saying that I feel sorry for those that hated this movie. They missed out on the powerful message and the beautiful story. I can only be glad for myself that I got to experience Pi's story. I know I was transformed. .

All the hype! Story about faith! Computer generated gimmicks! Boring!

Well, I went to my son's at Easter (He usually shows some after-dinner action flick with car chases.), he started his Blu-Ray, and "The Life of Pi" was emblazoned across his giant screen. I thought well, guess I'm stuck watching it. Within five minutes I was caught, spellbound, not only by the stunning beauty of the visual images but also by the flawless portrayals of the actors who were so natural that they didn't seem to be acting. Almost unawares I was so swept up with the story that I easily suspended my disbelief and was very close to tears at the utter beauty of what I was seeing. "The Life of Pi" is a cinematic masterpiece.

Of many scenes of magnificent beauty, the one in which the golden sky blended into the sea simply blew me away. The film is so astonishing that I quickly forgot my bias against CGI.

And I didn't mind the two endings. Whether the more prosaic version was the truth or not is irrelevant. For me, it provided a framework for the layered symbolism of the 'romantic' narrative.

Ang Li's visual motifs are reminiscent of the verbal motifs of Greek tragedy. They penetrate deeply into the psychology of the characters. The blurring of the boundaries between illusion and reality--the very ambiguity of 'what actually happened'--makes me want to watch the picture over and over, as there is so much to savour.

Happily, my son gave me the DVD as an Easter present!

I'm going to focus my review mainly on the 3D aspect of this Blu-Ray, and about how the movie compares to Avatar 3D-wise, which is to date the visual benchmark by which other 3D movies are judged. As for the movie itself it's an amazing piece of film-making whose plot and pace reminded me of the movie Castaway.

Now, onto the 3D:

When I originally watched the movie Avatar in theaters, its 3D effect blew my mind. For me, that movie is the benchmark all 3D movies should aspire to achieve, when it comes to 3D implementation. Over the years, and after watching avatar in the theater, I've watched a mixed bag of 3D movies that initially led me to believe 3D in the living room would never achieve the quality of what I watched in the theater when Avatar knocked my socks off and introduced me to the world of modern 3D. Then, after a period of exclusivity with Panasonic, Avatar 3D was finally made available on Blu-Ray. To my surprise, after watching avatar in 3D Blu-Ray in the comfort of my living room, it looked EXACTLY the same as in the theater. Perfect. Visually astounding. And one HUGE detail: Crosstalk free. (For the uninitiated, crosstalk if the effect present in many 3D movies in which the edges of objects on the screen look blurry and doubled. Many people not only find this effect annoying but it's known to case headaches and even nausea in many moviegoers). The fact that Avatar was 100% crosstalk free led me to one conclusion: 3D Blu Rays can look every bit as good in your living room as the movie originally looked on the theater screen, as long as the movie is done right, shot right and encoded right. Just like James Cameron did with Avatar. Which finally brings me to Life of Pi.

This Blu Ray movie packs the best 3D I've seen, after the hundred or so movies that have graced my TV screen since avatar. The 3D effect in Life of Pi is absolutely flawless. Crosstalk is absolutely non-existent. I can't stress this enough. The fact that this movie nails its 3D presentation and it contains zero crosstalk whatsoever, along with the masterful way in which director Ang Lee shot this movie take your movie experience to a whole new level. When you're watching the movie the absence of crosstalk allows you to forget for a second you're watching a Blu-Ray movie and that you-re wearing the stupid glasses and simply allows you to immerse yourself in the visuals. Your eyes get used to the new dimension they're perceiving instantly and you end up losing yourself in the lush landscapes and in the incredibly rich color palette this movie brings to your living room. The colors are so vibrant, the objects  so sharp and defined you almost feel you're looking through a glass.

Unlike gimmicky 3D movies that try to impress you by throwing objects at your face, the 3D effect in Life of Pie is used instead to immerse the viewer in this fantastic world. It's done tastefully, technically impeccably and with amazing results. And unlike said gimmicky 3D movies in which you feel like you're just watching a 2D movie with dark glasses 90% of the time, and the 3D is just reserved for fast paced action scenes that make up probably 10% of the movie, in Life of Pi 3D is present on the screen almost 99% of the time. Like it's one more color the director was able to play with when painting this masterpiece. You don't need to wait for an action scene to see the 3D in all its glory. As soon as the movie starts and you're presented with the lush visuals of an Indian zoo, you see the 3d in all its glory. 2 minutes into the movie the narrative takes you to the protagonist's living room where he is having a conversation with a book writer. Two characters sitting in a living room talking. A scene that most 3D movies wouldn't even consider introducing 3D on, (let alone using their 3D budget to enhance), yet in Life of Pi, as mundane as a scene like this could be, is giving the royal 3D treatment and you see the characters, perfectly defined in the foreground, and the rest of the living room, purposefully out of focus in the background, like if it is the background of the actual living room you're sitting in.

Whereas avatar is a CGI fest, (and that's a flavor of movie I also certainly enjoy) In terms of visual effects, Life of Pi is just a different animal. CGI, while definitely existent, is only one, amongst many aces under the  director's sleeve. He also plays, with color, (and boy does he!) contrast, angles, landscapes, and also the masterful 3D implementation to submerge you in the story.

To sum it up, not only is this an amazing movie totally worth watching, but this 3D Blu-Ray is one you will definitely want to keep on your shelf whenever you want to show your 3D setup to your friends. Along with avatar, it is in my opinion the finest example of 3D done right you can have in your collection. Definitely reference material for 3D quality, and also proof that whenever you get crosstalk ridden cheaply done 3D movies, is not because the technology is not there yet but because the movie was not shot or encoded properly, and basically they were cheap, lazy, or both. The technology to make your living room 3D look as good as the best theater 3D can offer, is definitely there. And Ang Lee took it and ran with it.

As a voracious reader, I feel the need to preface this review by saying that I have not read the book this film was based on. Not sure if I ever will, but there it is, I haven't. And thankfully it's not one of those "you HAVE to read the book to understand the movie" type of things. I thought the film started off slow, but it helped establish Pi's character rather than just toss him on a lifeboat with a tiger and wait to see what character development happens afterward. The reason for going by "Pi" was creative. And the telling of the story via flashbacks was a good choice; you got the sense that even so many years later, Pi still carries all of this with him every single day. The actors appeared very well cast in their roles -- I liked that Lee cast a lot of unknowns (or at least, unfamiliar to the Western world), because then you weren't distracted by preconceived notions of the actors' abilities and you could focus on the story the film was telling. Suraj Sharma did a particularly spectacular job, considering how his tiger companion was a character completely created in CGI. From a technical standpoint, Life of Pi deserved every Oscar it scored (Visual Effects, Director, Score, Cinematography). The score was subtle but stirring when it needed to be, and seemed to evoke more emotionally than the actors could, probably due to Pi's somewhat stagnant position on the lifeboat in the middle of the ocean. The night scene stands out to me as far as effects, score and cinematography are concerned because it just takes your breath away; between the infinite number of stars and the bright reflections of fish underwater to the breaching humpback, the entire scene was incredible to watch. And enough praise cannot be bestowed on the crew who worked to bring not just Richard Parker but all the other animals to life as well -- they all acted very realistically in regard to each other and to Pi himself. I have friends who've seen this film and thought it extremely boring -- maybe it's jsut me, but I can't understand how something so intriguing could bore someone. Broaden your mind with this film, it's a good one.
